Articles.Content: Have been playing the demo endlessly and have now finally got the full programme. Any tips for a noob looking to touch the stars (Or at least get into orbit!)?

Check out the MechJeb plugin. Watching it put a rocket in orbit can be very helpful in learning how to do it by hand.

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Welcome aboard!

If you want to achieve orbit, your best bet is 2-3 tanks with a powerful engine below, and a few SRBs on the sides. Start leaning eastward after reaching a 10km altitude and try to get above 70 km.

You can also take a look on the wiki for some tutorials.

One of the biggest problems to new people is Overengineering. Try to keep your rockets simple, but not too simple. Oh, and the optimal time and angle of tilting Varies from rocket to rocket. So, in simple, don't make your rockets TOO big, and tilt east once you begin to reach the thinner atmosphere.

Hiya Shamudrew and welcome to the community

Here is the link to MechJeb in case you need it, it's a good learning tool as Skunky says, have fun flying
